item.title: IllegalComponentStateException - Any ideas?
item.dc:creator: @Arightwizard Arightwizard
item.description:
@Arightwizard wrote:

[quote=“snoopy89, post:6, topic:289538”]Welcome to the fast type community.
And ow you didn’t have to open yourself like a book!
Why do you think I criticize you just because I had a good answer. feel hurt now.[/quote]
Wow. Is that the best comeback that you can come up with? Seriously?
Man, stop replying to a “newbie’s” thread and go back to whatever the hell you used to be doing.
This problem was solved, all you’re doing is rising up a fight.
So, captured within a sentence, shut up and leave my thread.

item.title: IllegalComponentStateException - Any ideas?
item.dc:creator: @Jessekinss Jessekinss
item.description:
@Jessekinss wrote:

[quote=“Arightwizard, post:5, topic:289538”]That’s just evil. I may be a junior member, but that’s just because I don’t necessarily like MoparScape. Honestly, I think most of the community knows little about Java or JavaScript. Only reason I posted the question here was because I can’t register on any better community.
Seriously though, I just wasn’t thinking correctly and didn’t examine the function’s coding. If I’d have examined the function’s coding, then I would’ve put “null” there.
Who are you to criticize someone you don’t even know? Someone that you have know idea has any skills in coding or not? I know a good answer to that question, for sure.
Oh yeah and,
“awnser?”[/quote]

Out of all those words, how come I only saw “QQ”?

item.title: IllegalComponentStateException - Any ideas?
item.dc:creator: @Arightwizard Arightwizard
item.description:
@Arightwizard wrote:

EDIT: Whoops…Wrong section…my bad, could anyone move this, please? To the 317 help and support section?

I feel like a newbie having to ask for help…
Anyway,
In a client I’m making, I have it set up so that when you click a button labeled “Port & Info,” a dialog box comes up asking for a port then it moves on to displaying client info.
When I compile, it works.
When I start up the client and click the button,
it gives me this error:

Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.awt.IllegalComponentStateException: This com ponent must have a parent in order to determine its locale at java.awt.Component.getLocale(Unknown Source) at java.applet.Applet.getLocale(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.UIManager.getString(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JOptionPane.showInputDialog(Unknown Source) at client.method135(client.java:9736) at client.method9(client.java:8485) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:122) at client.run(client.java:4276) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Here’s my code:

At the top:

import java.applet.Applet; import java.applet.AppletContext; import java.awt.*; import java.io.*; import java.math.BigInteger; import java.net.*; import java.util.zip.CRC32; import sign.signlink; import javax.sound.midi.*; import javax.sound.sampled.*; import javax.swing.*; import java.text.*;
When you click the button: (When you click it, it sets anInt833 to 3)

// Just to really help you, I'm going to label the line that it's erroring about.
//  The client and button used to work perfectly before I added this, so the problem must be within this area.
// So I'm only listing here.
        if(anInt833 == 3) {
                String s1 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Server Port:", ""); // Line 9376, client.java
                if(s1 == null)
                {
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "You must specify a port.", "No port specified.", 2);
                    return;
                }
                int i = Integer.parseInt(s1);
                setserver("", s1);
// The rest of the code goes here

Can anyone help me? I’d really appreciate a quick-fix.

Read full topic
